item.title: Engine Anti-Ice Valves – RB211 Valve Partially Open

remarks.para: One may be inoperative locked partially open provided:

numlitem.para: Reduced Thrust or Derate operation is not permitted,
Improved climb performance operation is not permitted,
Anti-ice OFF thrust settings are reduced by the following EPR decrements:
Engine anti-ice is selected ON for affected engine during entire flight, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: (RR Only) If L or R ENG ANTI-ICE EICAS message and associated valve light extinguish after advancing affected thrust lever (up to 1.04 EPR), continue normal operations. The message and light may come on again when the thrust lever is retarded, but will go out when takeoff power is applied. No logbook write-up is required. If the message and valve light do not go out when the thrust lever is advanced, comply with all applicable MEL procedures.
If ignition system is inoperative the engine anti-ice valve must be operative.

numlitem.para: Max Thrust required.
Do not use improved climb performance operation.
Observe MEL EPR decrements.
Observe reduced MEL takeoff and landing performance limited weight and obstacle clearance and en route climb limited performance weight.
Observe MEL V1 and VR increase.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: For RR engines, there is no Outside Air Temperature (OAT) restriction on the use of high thrust settings when operating with the EAI VALVE locked partially open.
Disregard Associated Valve Light and EICAS message indications, if any.

numlitem.para: Apply EPR decrement to all thrust settings.
Reduce Takeoff Runway Limit Weight by 10,200 lbs., if NOT OBSTACLE LIMITED.
Reduce Takeoff Runway Limit Weight by 11,300 lbs., if OBSTACLE LIMITED.
Reduce both Takeoff Climb Limit Weight and Climb Limit Weight for Landing by 10,200 lbs.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.
Reduce the ONE ENGINE INOPERATIVE NET EN ROUTE WEIGHT CAPABILITY found in Ch. 5.3 of the AOM by 11,300 lbs.
V1 and VR are increased by 1 knot.

placard.para: Placard appropriate Engine Anti-ice Switch "COWL VALVE INOP LOCKED PART OPEN" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

warning.para: TAG THRUST REVERSER LEVERS - "DO NOT OPERATE".

numlitem.para: Access engine inlet thermal anti-ice valve by opening the access panel on the appropriate engine.
For left engine, open access panel 413AL.
For right engine, open access panel 423AL.
Disconnect, cap and stow the valve actuation electrical connector.
Disconnect the valve position microswitch connector and connect to the adjacent socket.
Remove six bolts securing manual override assembly to valve body.
Lift manual override assembly clear of locating dowels.
Remove locking plate and gasket from locating dowels.
Lift microswitch assembly and gasket clear of locating dowels.
Place gasket on valve body.
Invert manual override assembly and replace on dowels so that tongue of screw jack engages with groove in valve head.
Place gasket and locking plate on manual override assembly so that valve position, as engraved on plate, is on top.
Move valve head to ("VALVE LOCKED CLOSED") by rotating jack screw until lug on jack screw locates in the slot on underside of locking plate.
Invert microswitch assembly and position on top of valve position locking plate.

note.para: THE MICROSWITCH ACTUATION LEVER MUST BE POINTING UPWARDS.

numlitem.para: Install six retaining bolts and secure assembly to valve head.
Check appropriate ANTI-ICE ENGINE L or R switchlight, on wing and engine anti-ice control panel (P5), is OFF.
Disregard associated VALVE light and EICAS message indications, if any.

para.emphasis: ENGINE ANTI-ICE VALVES – RB211 VALVE PARTIALLY OPEN

warning.para: tag thrust reverser levers – "do not operate".

note.para: Remove "DO NOT OPERATE" tag once the DMP is completed.

numlitem.para: Access engine inlet thermal anti-ice valve by opening the access panel on the appropriate engine.
Open left fan cowl for left or right engine.
Disconnect, cap and stow the valve actuation electrical connector.
Disconnect the valve position microswitch connector and connect to the adjacent socket.
Remove six bolts securing manual override assembly to valve body.
Lift manual override assembly clear of locating dowels.
Remove locking plate and gasket from locating dowels.
Lift microswitch assembly and gasket clear of locating dowels.
Place gasket on valve body.
Invert manual override assembly and replace on dowels so that tongue of screw jack engages with groove in valve head.
Place gasket and locking plate on manual override assembly so that valve position, as engraved on plate, is on top.
Move valve head to desired position ("VALVE LOCKED PART OPEN") by rotating jack screw until lug on jack screw locates in the slot on underside of locking plate.
Invert microswitch assembly and position on top of valve position locking plate.

note.para: THE MICROSWITCH ACTUATION LEVER MUST BE POINTING UPWARDS.

numlitem.para: Install six retaining bolts and secure assembly to valve head.
Check appropriate ANTI-ICE ENGINE L or R switchlight, on wing and engine anti-ice control panel (P5), is OFF.
Disregard associated VALVE light and EICAS message indications, if any.
